programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Family Adventures in Bonaire"
programme.desc: Blue World’s host, Jonathan Bird, takes his family, including his recently scuba-certified 11 year old son, on a dive trip to Bonaire in the Caribbean for some underwater family adventures. The kids find out that scuba diving is a family sport!

programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Searching for the Rare Blind Crayfish"
programme.sub-title: Searching for the Rare Blind Crayfish
programme.desc: Blue World goes on a search for a rare blind crayfish. Then we investigate why Hammerhead sharks tend to swim at an angle…tilted to one side.

programme.title: Super Senses 2: Special Forces S1 - "PATROL"
programme.desc: Life in the wild is life during wartime, and these animal soldiers have mastered the tactics of surveillance, stealth, and attack.

programme.title: Race of Life S1 - "The After Dark"
programme.desc: Delve into the shadows to uncover the secrets of nocturnal survival.

programme.title: Wildest Islands S1 - "Zanzibar: Land of Giants"
programme.desc: The Zanzibar Archipelago has been labelled the most exotic island chain in the world. Pristine sands and azure blue sea make it a much loved holiday destination, but many bizarre creatures also roam these islands.

programme.title: Wildest Islands S1 - "The Caribbean: The Wild Side of Paradise"
programme.sub-title: The Caribbean: The Wild Side of Paradise
programme.desc: The Caribbean is a tropical paradise. From just a few metres wide, to hundreds of kilometres across, each of the over 7,000 islands are different, and each has its own unique wildlife.

programme.title: Animal Society S1 - "Birds"
programme.desc: Birds have colonised every inch of our planet from the hottest jungles to the barren ice shelves of Antarctica. Coming in all shapes and sizes each having adapted to their environment with unique lifestyles.

programme.title: Animal Society S1 - "Predator canids"
programme.desc: Caniforms can be found in various habitats across the world. Divided into 9 families including all bears, wolves and foxes, their size and lifestyles vary considerably.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "School of Whales"
programme.desc: Follow a family of sperm whales in the heart of the Indian Ocean. Alongside a team of scientists, who have witnessed their most intimate moments over the past 7 years, we will lift the veil on the largest-toothed predator on earth.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Mardi Gras, Rock Candy, Dentures"
programme.desc: A look at how the amazing, and massive, decorations on Mardi Gras carnival floats are created, how rock candy is twisted together, and a look at how dentures are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Helmets, Tea, District Heating"
programme.desc: How do they harvest and treat the world's most expensive tea? Plus, how does the Siekierki power plant of Warsaw, Poland heat half the city's homes?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Royal Enfield, Art Fraud, Milk"
programme.desc: How do they engineer the latest incarnation of the classic Royal Enfield Continental GT motorbike? Plus, how do 'art detectives' spot a forgery?

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Asteroid or Alien Tech?"
programme.desc: It was discovered on October 19th, 2017 and it was recognized as the first known object of its type. It is unique since it is the first known object that came from our solar system. But while we observed it, the mystery surrounding it grew.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Human Propulsion"
programme.desc: Trisk skis can move a person quickly in the snow, but will he survive it?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Invention War"
programme.desc: Can you improve on the inventions of Da Vinci? Matt and Jeremy aim to find out as they take four re-invented weapons from past episodes and rethink, redesign, and rebuild them using modern technology.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Snow Annihilator"
programme.desc: Bizarre way to remove snow from roads. Will it work or will it just be a mobile furnace?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Bulletproof Protection"
programme.desc: See how inventions from the First World War work.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Raining Fish"
programme.desc: Alex is in Australia’s Northern Territory where a bizarre weather phenomenon took place. Hundreds of fish were reported to have rained down on the outback.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Spook Lights"
programme.desc: Alex Hannaford heads to America to investigate reports of balls of light, known as Spook Lights, floating in the night sky above a remote country road.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Tasmanian Tiger"
programme.desc: Alex seeks the truth behind a reported sightings of the continent’s biggest marsupial carnivore; an elusive wolf-like creature called the Tasmanian Tiger.

programme.title: Strange World S1 - "Toads"
programme.desc: Investigative journalist Alex Hannaford heads to Hamburg to uncover the truth behind bizarre headlines of exploding toads.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "Eerie sounds of a Violin"
programme.desc: Find out more about yacht’s, the seasons and sushi, plus explore the martial art of Taekwondo. Take a look at the devastation left in the wake of a Tsunami, and the playful and eerie sounds of a Violin.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "World’s Most Used Medications"
programme.desc: Ultimate is a game more commonly known as Frisbee, we’ll take a look at one of the world’s most used medications, Asprin as well as the Cello, Tattoo’s, Tea, Thanksgiving and Recycling.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "3D Printing Technology and Cloud Storage"
programme.desc: Take a deep dive into 3D Printing technology and Cloud Storage. Discover all there is to know about Trains, Mammals, what is an aerosol spray plus signs ad treatments of the Common Cold.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What Makes a Storm?"
programme.desc: Take a look at the many woodwind instruments, explore the benefits of tablet computers, plus find out what makes a storm! We cover the history of speakers, rubbing alcohol and find out about the planets.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Rotoscoping"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, we’ll discuss the animation technique of Rotoscoping, take another look at card tricks, the history of juggling and the popularity of the Smart phone.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Tilt Shift Photography and Night Hag Syndrome"
programme.sub-title: Tilt Shift Photography and Night Hag Syndrome
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, we’ll introduce you to Tilt Shift Photography, Night Hag syndrome and tightrope walking. Plus explore this weeks featured rethinker and tightrope walker Maria Spelterini.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "The Van de Graaff Generator"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, let’s take a look at the depth perception of 3D visuals and discover the Van de Graaff generator. Have you heard of overtone singing, we’ll explain this and more in Rethink.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "How does sword swallowing work?"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, there is a lot to discover. Have you ever had an eye floater, let’s examine what they are and how often they happen. How does sword swallowing work and how to use Jump Cuts in video editing.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Secrets of a Dog's Nose"
programme.desc: A dog's sense of smell can do amazing things. Dog can help humans sniff out all kinds of things that improve our lives, explosives, missing persons, illegal drugs. Now the latest research is revealing that dogs can detect disease, even cancer.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "ICARUS: Tracking Creatures From Space"
programme.desc: The ICARUS system monitors the movements and behaviors of Earth's creatures from space.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Voyage to Venus"
programme.desc: For the first time in decades, NASA is sending two new missions to Venus designed to study and explore the planet's atmosphere and earth-like composition.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Building The James Webb Telescope"
programme.desc: The story of the science behind the largest, most advanced, and most expensive telescope ever made.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "History of the Roller Skate"
programme.desc: Take a ride through the history of the roller skate, explore the ancient art of baking, and find out more about the versatile Bamboo plant and it’s many uses’ from medicine to musical instruments.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "Chopsticks, Coffee and Coins"
programme.desc: Find our about chopsticks, coffee, coins, cooking and cotton, in this exciting episode that also explores the various Dinosaurs and what it’s like to feel and prepare for an Earthquake.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Baklava/Gyroplane/Ukulele"
programme.desc: How do they make baklava, the favourite sweet of the Ottomans? How do they fly a gyroplane, James Bond’s vehicle of choice? How do they craft a ukulele, the Hawaiian instrument played by Elvis? How do they build a supercat, the world’s fastest ferry?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Longboards/Lemonade/Forklifts"
programme.desc: How do they carve longboards, the skateboard’s bigger, faster brother? How do they turn tonnes of lemons into millions of bottles of lemons? How do they build industry’s versatile heavy lifter, the forklift truck?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Coffee/Bricks/Lavalamps/Diamonds"
programme.desc: How do they roast the coffee that wakes up Italy? How do they bake the bricks that build America? How do they heat the oil that fills lava lamps? How do they blast diamonds from a frozen volcano?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Cameras/Big Airbags/ Jelly Beans"
programme.desc: How do they take the world’s sharpest photos? How do they stitch an airbag that can catch a falling car? How do they make billions of perfect jelly beans?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Caravans/Tuning Forks/Ice Resurfacer/Festival of Lights"
programme.desc: How do they build a caravan that’s tougher than an SUV? How do they forge tuning forks to provide musicians with perfect pitch? How do they resurface an ice rink in minutes? How do they put on the world’s biggest festival of lights?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S13 - "Vinyl Records/Bumper Cars/Tiger Balm"
programme.desc: How do they make the world’s grooviest music, the vinyl LP? How do they build the world’s most crashed car, the dodgem? How do they create one of the world’s oldest pain remedies, tiger balm?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Bond-ing with Larry"
programme.desc: Who is the greatest international action hero of all time, Terry Schappert? No. Terry and Larry get to test some scenes from James Bond films and other great action heroes.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Across the Great Divided Lonesome Mighty River"
programme.sub-title: Across the Great Divided Lonesome Mighty River
programme.desc: Everybody loves a great western! Except Larry. Terry gets Larry to test more scenes from classic western movies!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Down Mexico Way"
programme.desc: Don't mess with organized crime. The dynamic duo tackle scenes from the Mexico cartel series Queen of the South, but take a pitstop at the rest room to test a scene from The Foreigner with Jackie Chan.
